required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PASCONAL NERVENTROPFEN in the Treatment of Nervous Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: PASCONAL NERVENTROPFEN in the Treatment of Adults and Children Suffering From Nervous Diseases (e.g. Sleep Disorders Due to Nervousness)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to give an overview of the use of PASCONAL NERVENTROPFEN in a 2-4 week treatment of nervous diseases, especially sleep disorders due to nervousness.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this observational study is to give an overview of the use of PASCONAL NERVENTROPFEN in a 2-4 week treatment of nervous diseases, especially sleep disorders due to nervousness.
Efficacy and tolerability of the drug will be assessed. Special regard will be taken to the administration management, dose regimen, and to the effectiveness and safety in special patient groups (children 1-12 years of age), in relation to treatment conformity to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

primary_outcome.measure: Sumscore of 12 Individual Symptoms for Visit 1 (Baseline), Visit 2, and Visit 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1), appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2), and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
primary_outcome.description: The severity of 12 symptoms (nervousness/restlessness, irritability/eccentricity, sleep disorders, fitful sleep, hyperactivity, nocturnal activity, lack of concentration/forgetfulness, tiredness, discontent, listlessness, gastrointestinal problems, and headache/pressure) was graded on a four-point scale from 0 (no complaints) to 3 (strong complaints) and for the sum score of all 12 individual symptom scores (0 (no complaints) - 36 (all strong complaints).

primary_outcome.measure: Nervousness/Restlessness for Visit 1 (Baseline), Visit 2, Visit 3 and Last Obsevation
primary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1), appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2), and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
primary_outcome.description: The severity of nervousness/restlessness was graded on a four-point scale from 0 (no complaints) to 3 (strong complaints).

primary_outcome.measure: Irritability/Eccentricity for Visit 1 (Baseline), Visit 2, Visit 3 and Last Observation
primary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1), appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2), and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
primary_outcome.description: The severity of irritability/eccentricity was graded on a four-point scale from 0 (no complaints) to 3 (strong complaints).

primary_outcome.time_frame: appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2), and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of tolerability at visit 2 and visit 3 well tolerated = no side effcts poor tolerated = side effects

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of the Sum Score Between Baseline and Last Observation by Concomitant Medication and Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last obvservation (could be appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or 4 weeks (visit 3))
secondary_outcome.description: The severity of 12 symptoms (nervousness/restlessness, irritability/eccentricity, sleep disorders, fitful sleep, hyperactivity, nocturnal activity, lack of concentration/forgetfulness, tiredness, discontent, listlessness, gastrointestinal problems, and headache/pressure) was graded on a four-point scale from 0 (no complaints) to 3 (strong complaints) and for the sum score of all 12 individual symptom scores (0 (no complaints) - 36 (all strong complaints). Decrease of the sumscore between baseline and last observation by concomitant medication (with and withour medication) and treatment duration (< 4 weeks and >= 4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Direction of Change of Symptom Nervousness/Restlessnes Between Baseline and Last Observation by Concomitant Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last observation (could be appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3))
secondary_outcome.description: The symptom nervousness/restlessnesswas analysed with respect to the direction of change between baseline (Visit 1) and the last documented visit (Visit 2 or Visit 3) by means of the categories "improved", "unchanged" and "worsened". For each symptom patients were included in the analysis only if the symptom had been present at Visit 1 (i.e. the baseline score value was > 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Direction of Change of Symptom Nervousness/Restlessnes Between Baseline and Last Observation by Duration of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last observation (could be appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3))
secondary_outcome.description: The symptom nervousness/restlessness was analysed with respect to the direction of change between baseline (Visit 1) and the last documented visit (Visit 2 or Visit 3) by means of the categories "improved", "unchanged" and "worsened". For each symptom patients were included in the analysis only if the symptom had been present at Visit 1 (i.e. the baseline score value was > 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Direction of Change of Symptom Irritability/Eccentricity Between Baseline and Last Observation by Concomitant Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last observation (could be appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3))
secondary_outcome.description: The symptom irritability/eccentricity was analysed with respect to the direction of change between baseline (Visit 1) and the last documented visit (Visit 2 or Visit 3) by means of the categories "improved", "unchanged" and "worsened". For each symptom patients were included in the analysis only if the symptom had been present at Visit 1 (i.e. the baseline score value was > 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Direction of Change of Symptom Irritability/Eccentricity Between Baseline and Last Observation by Duration of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last observation (appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3))
secondary_outcome.description: The symptom irritability/eccentricity was analysed with respect to the direction of change between baseline (Visit 1) and the last documented visit (Visit 2 or Visit 3) by means of the categories "improved", "unchanged" and "worsened". For each symptom patients were included in the analysis only if the symptom had been present at Visit 1 (i.e. the baseline score value was > 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy Rating for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Last Value) Compared to Previous Therapy by Concomitant Medication (Yes/no)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the therapy with PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN was rated by the physician on a 4-point rating scale at Visit 2 and Visit 3. The same scale was applied at Visit 1 for evaluation of the efficacy of the previous medication. The last evaluation for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Visit 2 or Visit 3, according to the LOCF principle) was compared with the rating for the previous therapy by means of the categories "PASCONAL® better", "No difference" and "PASCONAL® worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy Rating for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Last Value) Compared to Previous Therapy by Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the therapy with PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN was rated by the physician on a 4-point rating scale at Visit 2 and Visit 3. The same scale was applied at Visit 1 for evaluation of the efficacy of the previous medication. The last evaluation for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Visit 2 or Visit 3, according to the LOCF principle) was compared with the rating for the previous therapy by means of the categories "PASCONAL® better", "No difference" and "PASCONAL® worse".

arm_group.description: adult patients and patients older than 12 years

study_pop.textblock:
Observational groups
Patients (adults and children 1-12 years of age) suffering from nervous diseases, e.g. sleep-disturbances due to nervousness.

criteria.textblock:
Due to the design as an Observational Study no inclusion or exclusion criteria for therapy are named. The included patient group is described under "Cohort / Group".
Observational Criteria (=inclusion criteria for documentation):
- Males and females
- Children 1-12 years old
- Adults >12 years old
- suffering from nervous diseases, e.g. sleep disorders due to nervousness.
Exclusion criteria for documentation:
- children younger than 1 year
- no nervous diseases, e.g. sleep disorders due to nervousness.
- no treatment with PASCONAL NERVENTROPFEN

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Physicians who were registered in the past with the treatment focus on central nervous system / psyche. The recruitment of the participating physicians was done by the field service of PASCOE.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: It was an non-inteventional observational study with 3 visits.

group.title: Observational Group
group.description: Pasconal Nerventropfen PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN is a homoeopathic combination product (oral drops) consisting out of 4 ingredients: Avena sativa, Valeriana, Ignatia and Tarantula.

participants_list.participants: 1 patient was only analysed for safety

group.title: Observational Group
group.description: Pasconal Nerventropfen

measure.title: State of inclusion diagnosis
measure.description: The duration of complaints was divided into two groups to the extent this was possible: Acute disease (duration of symptoms ≤2 months) Subchronic and/or chronic disease (duration of symptoms >2 months)

measure.title: Previous treatment of inclusion diagnosis
measure.description: Within the range of the observational study, it was ascertained whether the inclusion diagnosis had been treated previously.

class.title: with previous treatment of inclusion diagnosis
without previous treatment of inclusion diagnosis

analysis.groups_desc: decrease of the sum score between baseline (visit 1) and last observation was exploratively analysed
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with GLM (Generalized Linear Model) of SAS® (with type III sums of squares); including the baseline value of the sum score as a covariate

analysis.groups_desc: decrease of the sum score between baseline (visit1) and last observation by duration of treatment
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with GLM (Generalized Linear Model) of SAS® (with type III sums of squares); including the baseline value of the sum score as a covariate

outcome.title: Direction of Change of Symptom Nervousness/Restlessnes Between Baseline and Last Observation by Concomitant Medication
outcome.description: The symptom nervousness/restlessnesswas analysed with respect to the direction of change between baseline (Visit 1) and the last documented visit (Visit 2 or Visit 3) by means of the categories “improved”, “unchanged” and “worsened”. For each symptom patients were included in the analysis only if the symptom had been present at Visit 1 (i.e. the baseline score value was > 0).
outcome.time_frame: begin (visit 1) and last observation (could be appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) or appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3))

outcome.title: Efficacy Rating for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Last Value) Compared to Previous Therapy by Concomitant Medication (Yes/no)
outcome.description: Efficacy of the therapy with PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN was rated by the physician on a 4-point rating scale at Visit 2 and Visit 3. The same scale was applied at Visit 1 for evaluation of the efficacy of the previous medication. The last evaluation for PASCONAL® NERVENTROPFEN (Visit 2 or Visit 3, according to the LOCF principle) was compared with the rating for the previous therapy by means of the categories “PASCONAL® better”, “No difference” and “PASCONAL® worse”.
outcome.time_frame: appr. after 2 weeks (visit 2) and appr. after 4 weeks (visit 3)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
